text.author: Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia
text.title: Évariste Galois
text.summary: This excerpt gives details on French mathematician Évariste Galois' final days, in which he wrote his famous mathematical testament in a letter to Auguste Chevalier, before being shot in a duel provoked under unclear and possibly suspicious circumstances, on May 30th, 1832, and dying the next day.

head.s: Final JJ final AJ0 ADJ amod days NNS day NN2 NOUN root

figure.rend: A picture of Siméon Poisson's head and torso
